definition: to hand in/to hand over/to seize
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to transfer (income, profits etc) to higher authorities
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
to disarm/to lay down one's weapons/to surrender
to lay down one's arms/to surrender/to disarm
“surrender and your life will be spared”

sentences.english: The robber was captured and disarmed.
sentences.chinese: 那个抢劫犯被抓住了，并被缴了械。

sentences.english: We'll resume power in 48 hours after you pay the electricity costs.
sentences.chinese: 我们将在您缴电费后的48小时内安排送电。

sentences.english: High season surcharge may apply, please check with our company.
sentences.chinese: 旺季期间出发须缴附加费，详程请向本公司查询。

sentences.english: Someone even assumes that they have the right to waste water because they pay for it so that it has nothing to do with others.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者认为自己缴了水费就有权浪费，与他人无关。

sentences.english: In fact, one may pay for frustration on the way to success.
sentences.chinese: 挫折其实就是迈向成功所应缴的学费。

sentences.english: Distance makes the hearts grow fonder.
sentences.chinese: 缴距离使两颗心靠得更近。

sentences.english: She liked her grandfather very much.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩非常喜欢她的外公缴。

sentences.english: Yes Sir, but you have to bear a 10% registration fee.
sentences.chinese: 可以，先生，但您必须缴10%的登记费。

sentences.english: Will you spend the money on greens fees at a golf course?
sentences.chinese: 你会拿它去缴高尔夫球场的绿化费吗？

sentences.english: Can you tell me how much tax I will have to pay?
sentences.chinese: 你们能告诉我我要缴多少税吗？

sentences.english: The amount of money that the Bank can lend, based on its paid-in capital.
sentences.chinese: 在缴讫资本的基础上，世界银行可以进行贷款的数额。

sentences.english: The above Scholarship can only be used in paying Tom Lee Music Foundation course fee.
sentences.chinese: 以上之通利奖学金只适用于缴交通利音乐课程学费。

sentences.english: Applicants for the master program should submit a study plans in Chinese and English.
sentences.chinese: 申请就读硕士班须缴中文及英文读书计画书。

sentences.english: He paid 5,000 dollars in bail for his son.
sentences.chinese: 他缴了五千元保释出他儿子。

sentences.english: Applicants for the master program should submit a study plan in either Chinese or English.
sentences.chinese: 申请就读硕士班须缴中文或英文留学计画书。

definition: to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
to transfer (income, profits etc) to higher authorities
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
